intro: Pandiaka carsonii var. milnei, commonly known as Carson's pandora, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of California. It is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family, characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often emitting a subtle scent when crushed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
